results.title: The Use of measuring instruments: the burette
results.creator_credit: Australian Teaching Films and L.M. Simmons
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the correct use of the burette. Includes checking apparatus, rinsing, placing in stand, draining, filling, removing air bubbles, measuring a specified amount of liquid, emptying, cleaning and packing up after use.

results.title: The USA in world trade: round trip
results.creator_credit: Raymond Spottiswoode, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Roger Barlow
results.brief_description: Documents the importance and extent of world trade, emphasising its significance to the United States. An American auto worker, a southern farmer, a house-wife, a British machinist, a French labourer, and a Mexican farmer give their views on world trade. Dr Riefler, an economist, uses animated models to show the effects of tariffs, and reveals how nations are planning to bring about satisfactory trade arrangements.

results.title: The Urban challenge: learning a living
results.creator_credit: UNICEF, University of the State of New York, William Hetzer and Edward King
results.brief_description: Examines the plight of the urban poor in the USA, Thailand and Peru. Shows how in low income communities, opportunities for learning can be expected beyond school walls. Self-help community development projects, on-the-job training and professional guidance are organized to both increase literacy and to help people achieve a secure and rewarding life.

results.title: The Unvanquished = Aparajito
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Bibhutibhushan Banerji, this is the second part of the trilogy begun by Pather Panchali. Apu grows up and becomes restless for experience. Set in Benares in the 1920’s, the focus is on the changing environment, contrasted with the stasis of village life in Pather Panchali. Apu’s restlessness and desire for more education brings him into conflict with his mother. This realistic portrayal of family life drew a good deal of criticism from the middle class audience of the time.

results.title: The Untouchables
results.creator_credit: Art Linson, Linson Films, Paramount Pictures and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Al Capone reigned as King in Prohibition Chicago, 1931. A team of determined government investigators, led by a young Federal Treasury agent is committed to bringing Capone to justice. Unbribable and incorruptible, they are “The Untouchables”. Kevin Costner stars as the legendary Eliot Ness in this bold action thriller by famed director Brian De Palma. Along with Costner, Sean Connery gives an award winning performance as tough beat cop Jimmy Malone, while Andy Garcia and Charles Martin Smith are the rest of the team. Robert De Niro is chilling as the sadistic but seductive Al Capone; a man who smiles when he kills.

results.title: The Unsinkable sea otter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Undersea World of Jacques Cousteau”.
This shy sea mammal is fighting its way back to an ecological niche after two centuries of being hunted for its fur. But again the otter is under threat, both from abalone divers (who say it is destroying their supply) and from pollution of the coastal waters off Alaska and California. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: The Unsinkable Molly Brown
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Weingarten, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Helen Deutsch
results.brief_description: Debbie Reynolds stars in her Oscar nominated performance as the eponymous Molly Brown. Destined for better things, Western orphan Molly leaves her mountain cabin and her uneducated and poor upbringing in search of a rich husband and a better life in Denver society. In a typical rags to riches fashion, Molly becomes the wealthiest woman in society. Based on the musical play with music and lyrics by Meredith Wilson. Screen play by Helen Deutsch. Cast includes Debbie Reynolds, Harve Presnell and Ed Begley.

results.title: The Unseen enemy
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Damian Brown
results.brief_description: Safe, basic food handling methods are necessary to prevent contamination by bacteria. This film shows how unhygienic handling of cooked meats results in food poisoning.

results.title: The Unreal image
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Pair of Eyes”.
Drawing on his knowledge of the Middle East to illustrate his theme, with part of the film shot in Britain and Greece also, David Holden, journalist and former Times Middle East correspondent, presents the argument that modern communications increase the fragmentation of the world by bombarding the individual with stultifying stereotyped images.
